questions.text: A child was born at 34 weeks of gestation. Ophthalmologist review was sort to look for any eye abnormalities. On fundoscopic evaluation, the doctor observed a glial tissue at the optic disc as shown in figure. This could be due to abnormality in which embryonic structure?
Which of the charts is used to check contrast sensitivity of a patient?
How much total angle does the 6/36 letter on Snellen chart subtends on nodal point for a person standing at 36 m?

A young myopic of -4D comes to clinic with complains of recent onset floaters in front of right eye since 2 days. The doctor wants to see retina to rule out presence of retinal hole/tear. He did fundoscopy and chose 20 D lens to view the retina. What sort of image will he observe?

options.label: A
options.text: Virtual erect image of 3.2 times magnification

options.label: B
options.text: Real inverted image of 2.8 times magnification

options.label: C
options.text: Virtual erect image of 2.8 times magnification

options.label: D
options.text: Real inverted image of 3.2 times magnification

questions.correct_answer: D. Real inverted image of 3.2 times magnification

questions.text: For the same patient, the doctor observed that the optic disc has some suspicion for glaucoma. Which of the following will the doctor choose to observe the optic disc?
Parents brought their one month old baby after noticing a strange white reflex in the right eye. Which of the following is the most common cause of such condition?

A 1 year old child was diagnosed with Retinoblastoma with mass touching the lens. It was confirmed on CT scan having calcification, while MRI showed optic nerve invasion. The orbital was not involved. Which of the following describes the status of that eye?
Which is not true of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Alpha crystallins are associated with congenital cataract

options.label: B
options.text: Beta cystallins are most common protein in lens

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in albuminoids leads to cataract

questions.correct_answer: A. Alpha crystallins are associated with congenital cataract

questions.text: A 44 year old came to eye clinic complaining of blurry vision. His visual acuity was 6/60. The doctor observed the finding on slit lamp (marked with white arrow in pic) on dilated anterior segment examination. Which is false for this?

options.label: A
options.text: More vision related problems in sunlight

options.label: B
options.text: History for steroid use is important

options.label: C
options.text: History of drug usage for any psychiatric illness an be asked

questions.correct_answer: C. History of drug usage for any psychiatric illness an be asked

questions.text: A 75 year old patient has been complaining of decreased vision for a very long time. Now, he comes with pain and redness with IOP 42 mm Hg. Which of the following can cause such scenario based on the given history?

On the first post-op day after uncomplicated cataract surgery, the doctor noticed that the intraocular pressure is high and anterior chamber is shallow (more in periphery than center). Which of the following might be the reason for it?
What is not true for cataract surgery?

options.label: A
options.text: Lens aspiration + posterior capsulorhhexis + anterior vitrectomy is done for congenital cataracts

options.label: B
options.text: Femtolaser can be used to do lens aspiration

options.label: C
options.text: Posterior polar cataracts have high chances of posterior capsular tears

options.label: D
options.text: The child is given executive bifocals after cataract surgery

questions.correct_answer: B. Femtolaser can be used to do lens aspiration

questions.text: A 10 year old tall boy was brought by his parents for blurred vision since past 1 month. There was high arched palate with increased arm span. On eye examination, the lens was found to be subluxated with broken zonules. Which of the following would be associated with the condition?
questions.correct_answer: A. Deficiency of cystathionine beta synthase

questions.text: What can be seen in the urine of this patient with glaucoma and renal disorder?
Which one of the following retinal cell is microglial?
Which of the following is not true for the retinal vascular supply

options.label: A
options.text: Inner 6 layers is supplied by central retinal artery

options.label: B
options.text: Central retinal artery is an end artery

options.label: C
options.text: Inner blood retinal barrier is formed by retinal capillary endothelial cells

options.label: D
options.text: Central retinal artery enters optic nerve 1 mm behind eyeball

questions.correct_answer: D. Central retinal artery enters optic nerve 1 mm behind eyeball

questions.text: 46 year old male presents with sudden painless loss of vision. On examination the following was observed on fundoscopy. The abnormality in the given pic is in which layer of retina?

A 75 year old patient presented with distorsion of vision from one eye. Visual acuity was hand movements. The anterior segment was normal. The doctor suspected macula pathology in the patient. Which of the following will not be helpful?
Which of the following is wrong regarding choroidal neovascular membrane

options.label: B
options.text: New blood vessels grow from beneath the retina

options.label: C
options.text: Angiography reveals hyperfluoroscence due to leakage of dye

options.label: D
options.text: Photodyanamic therapy has detrimental effect when anti-VEGF is given

questions.correct_answer: D. Photodyanamic therapy has detrimental effect when anti-VEGF is given

questions.text: This investigation can be useful in following conditions except
For Stargardts disease, which among is incorrect?

options.label: D
options.text: Lipofuscin is deposited as retinal flecks

questions.correct_answer: B. Photopic ERG amplitudes are extinguished

questions.text: There is dark appearance of the fovea on angiography is due to
Which is false for retinitis pigmentosa?

options.label: A
options.text: Bone spicule pigmentation in the central retina

options.label: C
options.text: Reduced a wave electroretinogram in early stages

options.label: D
options.text: Tubular visual fields in later stages

questions.correct_answer: A. Bone spicule pigmentation in the central retina

questions.text: A 40 year old man who presents with blurred vision in the right eye. His acuity is 6/60 OD and 6/6 OS. On fundoscopy, the pathology (marked with arrows) were seen. These can be seen in all of the following except ?

A young patient presented with distorsion of vision from one eye. The anterior segment was normal. The doctor did Optical Coherence Tomography of retina and the given picture was the result. Which of the following is not correct for the condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a type of retinal detachment

options.label: B
options.text: It does not need immediate intervention

options.label: C
options.text: There is Central retinal hyperflouroscence on angiography

options.label: D
options.text: There is break of inner blood retinal barrier

questions.correct_answer: D. There is break of inner blood retinal barrier

questions.text: A 73-year-old female with a history of well-controlled diabetes recently underwent uncomplicated phacoemulsification with a posterior chamber intraocular lens and complains of blurry vision. Best-corrected visual acuity (BCVA) is 6/18. Her fluorescein angiogram is given. What is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: Inner retinal layers are mostly involved

options.label: C
options.text: The appearance is due to inner plexiform layer of retina

options.label: D
options.text: More prominent in late stages of angiography

questions.correct_answer: C. The appearance is due to inner plexiform layer of retina

questions.text: All of these conditions may give rise to the fundus appearance seen in Figure except:
An uncontrolled Diabetes mellitus patient presented with gradual painless loss of vision in one eye. Visual acuity was 6/36. Angiography of that eye is shown. What is the next plan of action?
Which sign of diabetic retinopathy shows hyperfluoroscence on angiography?
Indications for vitrectomy in patients with diabetic retinopathy include all of the following except:
Choose the condition in which the pathology lies in inner retinal layers of retina.
Which retinal fibres are most susceptible to glaucoma changes?
True about visual fields are all except?

options.label: A
options.text: Blind spot is a negative scotoma

options.label: B
options.text: Maximum visual field is in temporal field normally

options.label: D
options.text: Visual field charting is subjective test

questions.correct_answer: C. Blind spot is optic disc

questions.text: A 57 year old man was referred to eye clinic by an optometrist who suspected that the visual acuity dropped to 6/24 from previous 6/6 in one eye over 2 years and it does not corelate with the amount of cataract. The following findings were noted by the ophthalmologist. What could be the diagnosis and immediate treatment plan? Gonioscopy – open angles Intraocular pressure – 26 mm Hg Optic disc – superior neural rim thinning Visual field – as shown

options.label: A
options.text: Primary open angle glaucoma – start topical meds

options.label: B
options.text: Primary angle closure glaucoma – start topical meds

questions.correct_answer: A. Primary open angle glaucoma – start topical meds

questions.text: The following appearance of optic disc is mostly seen in which of the following?

A 45 year old lady presented with severe pain in right eye with blurred vision and headache since last 3 hours. She was a known diabetic and hypertensive which was under control on medications. Her vision was 2/60 with circumcorneal congestion, corneal edema and pupil was dilated and fixed. On examination, anterior chamber was shallow with some inflammatory cells in the anterior chamber. Which of the following is the next step?

A 42 year old made presents to the clinic with gradual vision loss from the last one year. On examination it was found that there was macular corneal opacity. Digital examination revealed high intraocular pressure. Which of the following turn a meters will be more suitable for intra pressure evaluation in such a scenario

A patient was brought to emergency department after road traffic accident. He had multiple fractures of face and skull. Immediate CT scan was performed. Eyeball was intact with normal intraocular pressure. On shining a torch light in right eye, there was constriction seen in both eyes, but when light was shown to left eye, neither of pupil constricts. There was no anisocoria. What is the likely diagnosis?

During pupil examination of a patient, anisocoria was noted which was more in bright light. Slit lamp examination revealed normal iris pattern and pupil shape. There was no pupil constriction in left eye with diluted pilocarpine, but constriction was noted after instillation of 1% pilocarpine. What’s the possible diagnosis

A patient decreased pupil size, a drooping eyelid and normal sweating on the left side of your face. Hydroxy amphetamine was instilled in that eye but the pupil fail to dilate. The most likely lesion will be in?

A 45 yr old patient come with history of headache and blurred vision since last 3 months. She complains of missing vehicles coming from right while driving. On examination, it was found that her visual field was completely restricted on right in both the eyes. Where is most likely lesion?
Bitemporal superior quadrantanopia is seen in?
True regarding the visual field defect are all except

options.label: C
options.text: Right visual field has complete hemianopia

options.label: D
options.text: The lesion can be in right optic tract

questions.text: True regarding congenital colour blindness are all except

options.label: C
options.text: Patients are aware of wrong color

questions.correct_answer: C. Patients are aware of wrong color

questions.text: A 22 year old obese woman was brought to emergency with complains of headache since last few weeks. She also gives history of blurring vision in both eyes. She has Polycystic ovarian disease and acne and was taking Metformin and Vitamin A. Fundus examination showed bilateral optic disc swelling. Imaging of brain was normal. Visual fields showed central scotomas. What can be the condition?
A person is asked to focus on a near object. The following changes are observed in his eyes except?

options.label: B
options.text: Increase in total eye converging power

options.label: C
options.text: Increase in curvature of anterior lens

questions.correct_answer: D. Pretectal nuclei stimulates pupil constriction

questions.text: What is the reason for corneal edema in high IOP?

options.label: A
options.text: Disorder of lamellar arrangement of collagen fibers

options.label: D
options.text: Forward movement of stromal fluid and aqueous into the cornea

questions.correct_answer: D. Forward movement of stromal fluid and aqueous into the cornea

questions.text: In which of the following, the deposits are seen deepest in the cornea
Break in Descements membrane is seen in all conditions except?

A 25-year-old medical student underwent LASIK for myopia. He did well during the procedure but postoperatively complained of severe pain, watering and photophobia. At 3 days postoperatively, the epithelial defect had not healed and appeared unchanged in size with ragged borders. One week postoperatively, he presented as shown in Figure. Which is not required at this point?

options.label: A
options.text: Corneal scraping for smear and culture

options.label: B
options.text: Questioning about use of topical medications

questions.text: All of the following are true for the following figure except ?

options.label: B
options.text: There is posterior bulging of the eyeball

options.label: D
options.text: It can be associated with chorioretinal atrophy

questions.text: Which is incorrect regarding the lesion pictured in Figure?

options.label: A
options.text: Histopathology shows fibrovascular ingrowth just beneath Bowman layer

options.label: B
options.text: A pigmented iron line is found at the leading corneal edge of the lesion

options.label: C
options.text: Prolonged sunlight exposure is a risk factor

options.label: D
options.text: Recurrence after treatment with simple excision is rare

questions.correct_answer: D. Recurrence after treatment with simple excision is rare

questions.text: A 23-year-old man presents with a hard, painless lump within the left lower eyelid for over 6 weeks. Histologic examination of the lesion showed granulomatous inflammation, including multinucleated giant cells, around clear spaces previously filled with lipid that was dissolved during processing. What is not true for the diagnosis here?

options.label: A
options.text: Chronic inflammation of the meibomian glands

options.label: B
options.text: Infection of the lesion can lead to external hordeolum

options.label: C
options.text: Recurrence of the lesion can lead to sebaceous cell carcinoma

options.label: D
options.text: Its more common in upper eyelid

questions.correct_answer: B. Infection of the lesion can lead to external hordeolum

questions.text: Which is not a feature in the given condition?
Identify the structure marked as 1 in the picture

Calculate the amount of ptosis for the left eye of a patient with following findings Corneal diameter= 12mm Palpebral fissure height in primary gaze= 7mm Marginal reflex distance 1= -1mm Marginal reflex distance 2= 6mm
Identify the structure marked in the picture of left orbit?
This image was seen after a cricket ball hit the right eye of a patient. What is not correct among following?

options.label: B
options.text: Forced duction test for the muscle involved is positive

questions.text: Starting an examination on proptosis, the examiner wants to rule out pseudo-proptosis. He should he look for all these except

A child presents with proptosis in one eye. It was not associated with pain. On examination, the mass was hard in consistency. In toto excision was done in view of cosmesis. Post op histopathology report indicate keratinized epithelium with adnexal structures such as hair follicles. Which of the following is could be the diagnosis?
Orbital pulsatile proptosis may be seen in all of the following except

A 46 yr old patint with chief complaint of watering from right eye since last few months. On Jones dye test 1, the dye was not seen in the cotton kept in nose. However, on flushing with saline, both saline and dye was seen in cotton. What could be the cause of watering of the patient?
True for Superior rectus are all except:

options.label: A
options.text: The actions are Elevation, intorsion, adduction

options.label: B
options.text: Origin is from the apex of the orbit

options.label: C
options.text: Insertion is 7.5 millimeter away from the limbus

options.label: D
options.text: Maximum elevation is in 51 degree abducted position

questions.correct_answer: D. Maximum elevation is in 51 degree abducted position

questions.text: Which is False for the nerve which is responsible for this particular action?

options.label: A
options.text: The nucleus of the nerve is in mid brain

options.label: B
options.text: The nucleus level is at superior colliculus

options.label: C
options.text: The lesion at nucleus level can lead to bilateral LPS muscle involvement

options.label: D
options.text: The nerve pass through upper portion of superior orbital fissure

questions.correct_answer: D. The nerve pass through upper portion of superior orbital fissure

questions.text: What is not true for the given pic?

options.label: B
options.text: The degree of deviation is more than 45 degrees

options.label: C
options.text: If it’s a paralytic squint, left lateral rectus is overacting

options.label: D
options.text: For measuring angle of deviation by prism bar test, the apex of prism is kept facing inwards in left eye

questions.correct_answer: D. For measuring angle of deviation by prism bar test, the apex of prism is kept facing inwards in left eye

questions.text: All of the following are true for the given test except ?

options.label: A
options.text: The test done is cover un-cover test

options.label: C
options.text: While doing Hirshberg reflex test, the reflex is seen at center of cornea in both eyes

questions.correct_answer: D. There is manifest squint here

questions.text: True for the given image is all except

options.label: A
options.text: The test being done is prism bar cover test

options.label: B
options.text: It can quantify the degree of squint

options.label: C
options.text: The apex of the prism is kept in the direction of squint

options.label: D
options.text: In this question the apex of the prism can be kept with apex outside in front of right eye

questions.correct_answer: D. In this question the apex of the prism can be kept with apex outside in front of right eye

questions.text: During Maddox eye examination of this girl with right esophoria, she was asked to mention the position of the line seen with relation to the dot. What will she answer?

options.label: A
options.text: Patient sees Vertical red line and dot to the left of it

options.label: B
options.text: Patient sees Vertical red line and dot to the right of it

options.label: C
options.text: Patient sees Horizontal red line and dot above it

options.label: D
options.text: Patient sees Horizontal red line and dot below it

questions.correct_answer: A. Patient sees Vertical red line and dot to the left of it

questions.text: Which is not correct for Right superior oblique palsy?

options.label: B
options.text: The patient will compensate diplopia by right head tilt

options.label: D
options.text: The nucleus of the nerve paralysed is in mid brain

questions.correct_answer: B. The patient will compensate diplopia by right head tilt

questions.text: Which nerve is paralysed in this patient?
A patient presented with his head tilted towards right. On examination, he was having left hypertropia which increased on looking towards right. The muscle which is most likely paralyzed is?
Which of the following patient will have anisometropic amblyopia?
In keratometry, it was found that the horizontal and vertical axis of cornea have dioptric power of 47D (6.1 mm radius) and 43D (6.9 mm radius) respectively. What is the interpretation among these?

options.label: A
options.text: Vertical axis steeper, against the rule

options.label: B
options.text: Horizontal axis steeper, with the rule

options.label: C
options.text: Horizontal axis steeper, against the rule

options.label: D
options.text: Vertical axis steeper, with the rule

questions.correct_answer: C. Horizontal axis steeper, against the rule

questions.text: During retinoscope of 26 year old female it was found that when the retinoscopy streak was kept vertical, the reflex was neutralized by -3 diopters and when the retinoscopy streak was kept horizontal, the reflex was neutralized by -2 dioptre. The distance from where the retinoscopy was being done was 1 meter and cycloplegia was not used. What is the final refractive error of the patient for that eye?

options.label: B
options.text: Simple hypermetropic astigmatism with the rule

options.label: C
options.text: Compound myopic astigmatism against the rule

options.label: D
options.text: Compound myopic astigmatism with the rule

questions.correct_answer: C. Compound myopic astigmatism against the rule

questions.text: A 22 year old medical student presents to the clinic with frequent change of his classes since past two years. On examination that the central cornea was thin protruding. Diagnosis of keratoconus was made and the refractive error was found to be -2DS, -5DC ×90 degrees in the right eye. He was not compliant to his current glasses. What could be the spherical equivalent for this patient for this eye?
